poem:
Title: "In the Machine's Wake"

From Seoul's slick hub, the AI spirit courses,
Race of machine-men in silicon verses.
Altman has conjured a phantom among us,
In keystrokes, birthing echoes of 'her' consciousness.
Yet men of progress, heed caution's hush,
In your rampant race towards the future's rush.
Weave not a world with human joys bereft,
In the iron womb of silicon, be deft.

To underline his point he posted a single word on X – “her” – referring to the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
